Reviews.Title: “Better than American Best Westerns”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights - 3 people/2 rooms. I gave up my car rental because it was 20Euros to park in their tiny parking lot with an SUV. There were very few places and a time-consuming process due to space constraints. Hotel is located just around the corner from S-bahn and it is only 14Euro ride to the Tegel airport. We purchased the 22Euro pp "City" Bus tour around the city valid for 2 days and it was ideal for hop-on/hop-off. The bus driver even picks you up at 9am at the hotel and the closest tourist point is only a brief walk of three blocks. Rooms were newly renovated. If you have a handicap person in the party - room 113 is ideal! There are 5 steps up to the area for the restaurant which would be an issue if unable to walk. However, hotel has an elevator so getting to the rooms is no problem. The TV's were the old tube kind but the beds were comfortable, excellent lighting and enough closet space for suitcases. We didn't have views on the first floor except to an inner courtyard but the casement style windows functioned beautifully and you could get nice frest air and no noise except birds chirping. Lobby bar is sophistated and convenient. At check-in we were given courtesy certificates for a free beer which may be part of the Best Western FF program. The bar tender aka concierge aka front desk staff let us substitute for whatever we wanted soda or wine. It's not the kind of hotel that will recognize you by name or know too much about tourist attractions but they are friendly and accomadating. Breakfast served from 6-10am had a center island with breads, jams, scrambled eggs, bacon, cheeses, fruit, cereals, juices, pots of coffee on the table. It's not your American plastic plate and plastic forks - this Best western had tablecloths, silverware, china and nice presentation. Hotel is located close to several pastry shops, grocery stores, Gallery mall, walking street, lots of shopping, there were musicians on the street. I would stay at this location again if in Berlin but would check out the crowne plaza or radisson closer in the tourist area too since In June the Tegel airport is closing and the new airport is much further out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: m5893_tripad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times for a few days each in the last 3 years. The hotel is located away from the city center, but right next to an S-Bahn station, which can take one both to the center and also to Potsdam, which was convenient in my case. The bus to Tegel Airport also stops around the corner. The breakfast is great. The rooms are quite spartan, but clean. There is free WiFi. During one of my stays there was some construction work going on in the morning, and I asked for my room to be switched to the other side of the building -- they gave me a better room at no extra charge. Overall the hotel is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lussie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located is in a great location. It is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very nice, as were the servers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: BLG_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent place to stay. The clean and relatively new room was satisfying both for work and relax. The hotel is centrally located, with bus stop and U-bahn just outside the door, S-bahn around the corner and, - until the new airport BER opens,- bus to Tegel 2minutes walk to the next corner. Berlin is a perfect city to walk in, so we can also recommend Kantstrasse for safe walking even at night. We stayed there a week and enjoyed it. Friendly staff and tasty breakfast included in the room-rate. Otel.com gave us a good offer. We slept well in a king-size bed, not taking any notice of the traffic outside. We will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: paula188633
Reviews.Content: In this hotel I stay about 3 times a year for 2 nights, visiting friends in Charlottenburg. It is centrally located, a few seconds from the Wilmersdorfer Strasse which I like very much, and the Wilmersdorfer Arcaden, a nice shopping mall.The rooms are clean and the breakfast is ok. It is hard to find a hotel like this in Berlin for such a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast, close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Pedersang Posted by a Choicehotels traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, with one of the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in. Friendly staff. Close to excellent, but a lot of noise from the hall through a crack between the door and the floor. Noisy swedes late at night. Too bad! Very good cleaning throughout our 3-night stay. Nice towels, warm shower. McDonalds next to the hotel, so you will never go hungry! Breakfast very ok for a 4* hotel. Close to both U-bahn, and S-bahn. Airport express service to Schönenfeld nearby! Best of all! Price! I booked via coophotellkupp.com. This is a norwegian site for members of Coop. If you see a good price, book it!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Accommodations, Unresponsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michele G
Reviews.Content: First the good: Hotel is centrally located with lots of shopping & restaurants nearby. Also, subway & streetcar stations are within a 5 minute walk. Breakfast buffet has a nice variety. Now the bad: Our double-occupancy room was spartan, providing only the essentials and nothing fancy or luxurious. There were no drawers for us to put clothing. No luggage rack to put our suitcase on. This was an issue for me because a back condition makes it difficult to bend down and retrieve clothes from floor level. My needs were immediately communicated to the staff, who assured me "one was on order". Although we stayed 5 nights, I never received one. We received ONE face cloth for TWO people EVERY DAY. We had to request an additional cloth EVERY DAY. Soiled drinking glasses were never moved or replaced with clean ones...for our entire stay. No access to ice. No in-room coffee or tea making supplies. No thermostat for our room. The heat is centrally controlled for the entire hotel. Also, be very careful when making a local call from your room. We made 1 local call lasting about 3 minutes and were charged 5 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leodis57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin in April for a four day holiday. The hotel was small but modern in style and nicely furnished. Our bedroom/ ensuite was good if a little on the small size. The breakfast was excellent with the tables spaced apart so you weren't sitting on top of the people at the next table. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. Although a little way from the city centre, it was relatively easy to reach all the main sites - the Berlin transport system is excellent. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Alebir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite easy to get to from the airport by a regular bus It was a bit far from the center by foot, but very close to other publique transportations an walking distance to the "Kurfürstendamm" The personal in the recetion were very helpfull with all sorts of helpful information The room were Ok, though without AC as usual! But at least had free WI FI Breakfast also OK!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, good location in western part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LarsScreen
Reviews.Content: [Actually I was there in June 2010...] Very fresh feeling hotel, with great & luxurious breakfast (tuxedo mandatory ;-) ?). Maybe my TV was a bit small (15/17" ?), but I chose the cheapest room available (!). I just wanted somewhere (nice!) to sleep. The employed was anyhow helpful, fast & professional, quite good comprehension of my bad english dialect. All in all, a safe bet in westen part ("sector") of Berlin, near subway, buses...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times; the breakfasts were excellent. The location is great for those who are keen to step out of the hotel and land straight into the hub of the city, (our teenage boys also approved of a Macdonalds restaurant next door!). Our rooms were situated at the back of the hotel and were probably quieter than those at the front that faced a busy dual carriageway. The rooms were clean and perectly adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A_Snail_Travelling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The location is good, easily accessible by bus from the Tegel airport. A lot of restaurants and supermarkts around the hotel. The room is quite outdated. The shower is not comforable because of bad curtains. Internet access is free. The break first is ok. A good value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Mattinbrum
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be highly recommeded: - spotlessly clean - comfortable rooms - free wi-fi -fantastic breakfast The staff were friendly and helpful too and the hotel is fairly central .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: MustaPekka
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel which was chosen because of its proximity to Tegel airport. Airport is only 20 mins away by bus no 109. Also subway (U Bahn & S Bahn) is very near the hotel making it a very good choice for getting around. Checkin was fast and friendly. Had requested a quite room, and was upgraded to a business room pointing at the backside of the hotel. Rooms facing the main street could be noisy because the traffic is rather heavy on that side. Room was spacious and in very good condition. Only disappointment was the old fashioned TV being 13"" or 14" ? Today a flatscreen TV should be standard in any hotel. WIFI was free and worked very well. Breakfast was very good fulfilling all my needs. All in all a very pleasant stay and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stop for a citybreak”
Reviews.Author: Drew1962_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of September. The hotel was excellent although we were upgraded to a business class room at the rear. I think we would have found a front room too noisy as the street is busy at all hours. The hotel's big plus point is its proximity to the underground just accross the road and the S-Bahn 2mins round the corner which take you everywhere you would want to go in 15m and is on a direct line to the airport. The buffet breakfast is amongst the best I have had in a 3 star. There are good places to eat and drink nearby especially round Sauvigny Platz 10m away. All in all a great place for a great break and we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious clean rooms, fabulous service, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LindaAxbridge
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It didnt look much from the outside and we were actually quite worried when we arrived late at night! But once inside it was cosy and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room was surprisingly spacious, and the bathroom was lovely with heated floor! But best of all, even though the hotel was set in a very busy location, our room was surprisingly quiet! (we did ask for a quiet room). Breakfast was very good, eveything you could wish for! There is an underground right outside, and train station just around the corner, so perfect for getting out and about. Probably one of the best city hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “easy access to public means of transport”
Reviews.Author: wolf1050
Reviews.Content: Preface: spent 3 nights in hotel Location: underground (Wilmersdorferstraße) and S-Bahn (Charlottenburg) at hand, bus-stop in front of hotel takes you to Zoologischer Garten (2 stops), all sights can be accessed easily and quickly. Front-desk: very friendly and supportive, great staff Parking: in garage, is EUR 20 a day, if I remember correctly; but parking space is few and far between in that area, so just park your car in the garage – get yourself a surprise, you don’t drive the car into the garage….. Room: two types: the ones to the street (Kantstraße) may be loud, a 2 two-lane street that is, with lots of traffic; they also offer rooms into a yard/garden, call these rooms ‘business rooms’, which we had – and these are very quiet (slightly more Euros though, but a good investment), quiet, even when the window is open – there is no a/c, so some fresh air is needed, specially in summer. Furniture I’d say could be more posh, but room was ok in size and quality. Only thing we disliked was the strange smell in the bath-room; we assume the syphon of the shower (open shower, syphon in tiled floor) needs some anti-syphon trap, or in other words, something, so that the smell, from where ever, can’t escape into the bath-room and then into the room. That problem, however, seems to be a problem of #315, as the other rooms, according to the plan presented on the floor, seem have a much smaller bath-room, and thus a shower with no syphon directly in the floor. Breakfast: was ok, but more or less average fot that type of hotel, with friendly staff. Miscellaneous: access to Berlin-sights is perfect, various means of public transport readily available; pedestrian-zone with lots of shops just across the street. Summary: would go there again. Internet: WLAN FOR FREE - that's the way it should be in all hotels. Check out our video-clip of hotel at http://www.youtube.com/fluglehrer#p/a/u/0/cW48Xu94xGk

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dany_de-from_bruges
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated as a base to to visit Berlin by public transport : bus stop at the door, U-Bahn 20 meters, S-Bahn a few steps away and the train station a few minutes walk. Around the corner is a pedestrian shopping street including a indoor shopping centre.The fact that you only can have a perfect breakfast in the hotel was in no way an objection, because eat-drink-terrace possibilities are in the neighbourhood for each (low) budget: McDonalds, local and exotic cuisine ... The rooms in the hotel are immaculate and worth the 4 * . Our room was on the busy street and with the closed window, there was really nothing to hear. But it was 30 ° C and very hot at night and then we had to leave the window open towards the noisy street. It is the only downside we can cite. Tip: Ask a room at the rear ...(but i just read it's business class...) The breakfast buffet was plentiful and was continuously supplemented. Nothing to complain! In short, the very attractive offer on the Internet was worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - NO Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: cannonwa
Reviews.Content: Was a good hotel for the money. Well situated near the "S-Bahn" stop, shopping, and local eateries. However, not a good spot when the weather's warm. Hotel is older and does not have air conditioning, nor do they have fans available to circulate some fresh air from outside. Many rooms face the very busy and noisy street below. Kanto Strasse (street) is a long Avenue / Boulevard, which channels sound a little "too" well. You'll hear emergency vehicles coming and going from 3-minutes away until their impossibly loud siren reverberates through your room, loud enough to wake the dead! I was moved to the back-side / courtyard-facing room, which happens to be only their "Business-class" rooms. Much nicer, larger, and... quiet. If you're there in the summer and it happens to be very warm, there's a Woolworth department store accross the street. Check-in early and go buy a fan. The Hotel has a unique car garage (@ 20 Euros/day), which is completely automated. You drive-in to a large car elevator/lift and it automatically slots your car for you (without you in it). You just tell the front-desk your vehicle stall # and they recall it for you, facing the opposite way you drove-in; very kewl. Breakfast was wonderful. A very generous & fresh buffet with much to choose from; delicious! Very friendly and responsive wait staff. The "S-Bahn" train is just a few blocks away and provides a very convenient means of reaching the downtown area attractions. Make sure to buy the "Tageskarte" (day-pass). I would come here again, but only in the Spring, Fall, or Winter.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: ice-lemon82
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel!! Stayed here for 5 nights and we had a fab stay! Great location from schoenefeld airport. (Took a taxi from airport and it was very reasonable). Bit of a walk from the centre of Berlin but good transportation links around the hotel. Good restaurants nearby and a McDonald’s right next door! Staff knowledgeable and friendly, breakfast adequate. Would return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bremer1981
Reviews.Content: We needed a convenient hotel for Schoenefeld. This was a good choice. Good clean, comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: Good location and a nice hotel. Right next door to the U-Bahn station Wilmersdorfer Straße. We had 7 rooms and all were very good though they got a bit hot at night - even in December. Breakfast was OK but I've had better. The hot breakfast consisted solely of scrambled egg and bacon, but the cold meats and cheeses were OK. Nice Plasma / LCD Tv on the wall in the bedroom. If you stay here you should try to get a table in the House of a Hundred Beers just round the corner past the U-Bahn and under the railway bridge. It was a good and very popular local bar / restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: KATZLondon
Reviews.Content: Good location, great transport links, breakfast ok (not great for fried but ok for continental) beds VERY comfortable. However the rooms have no air conditioning which means you will probably not be able to sleep without the windows open during the summer as it gets stifling hot. The only problem is that if you have a room at the front the traffic is VERY noisy so bring earplugs. The hotel is likely to be fully booked so they will be unable to change rooms. One of our party had to change rooms as it smelled of cigarette smoke but they changed it. They also tried to give us a twin room when we had paid for a double but we insisted they changed it. (These were all front-facing rooms) There is a cool little place that looks like a coffee shop next door that does huge cocktails for 5 euro. We found a lovely Italian half way down Leibniz Str and more restaurants around Walter- Benjamin Platz

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jeffcar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Kant with my wife, we were worried about airport transfer from Schoenfeld Airport , could not be easier took the S9 stright to Charlottenburg station . then 3 minute walk to Hotel . Make sure you get a welcome travel card at the station excellent value . We did not arrive until 10.30 pm so we asked reception to recommend a nearby Restaurant , the Italian across the road was excellent value and staff very friendly . The hotel we found very clean , the Breakfast was very good also, the drinks in the bar are a bit expensive ,look for the bar next door though a lot cheaper . Right outside the hotel is the bus stop you can get one of two buses from here to the zoological station area , very easy the last one returns at 1.30pm, but you can also catch the S9 again from the zoological station good night out is at the Irish bar in the europa centre live music until 3.00am All in all we found Berlin and the Kant a good experience and will return soon

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Kant”
Reviews.Author: Catherine.Murphy
Reviews.Content: Very convenient. Enjoyed staying in this part of Berlin. Great shops, restaurants play facilities. Fabulous transport links. Everything cheap and good quality. We had a problem with our room on the first night. It was too small, and overlooked main road. Moved on the second day to a larger room, refurbished and overlooking the courtyard. Peaceful. Enjoyed breakfast. All in all, a great week's stay would go back. The brochure did say complementary coffeee available 24/7 - not the case except at breakfast. Staff knowledgeable and helpful except when sending us to the long closed Egyptology museum. Looking forward to going back to Berlin and the Kant soon.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: WaltR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for both the S bahn and U bahn transport systems being only about 2 minutes walk from both. The young staff were all very helpful and all spoke far better English than my limited German. The breakfast was adequate but a tour group sat before us ate all the bacon and despite a request for more none was forthcoming. The room was clean but if I stayed again I would ask for a room on the inside rather than one overlooking the main road as that turned out to be rather noisy if you kept the window open - there was no air conditioning.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Kantstrasse
HotelInfo.Address: Kantstrasse 111, 10627 Berlin, Germany
